Description: Limestone ostracon: with black-painted representation of Ptah, enthroned, with vertical registers of hieroglyphs before and after and further text above.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Biban el-Muluk (Valley of the Kings - Thebes)
Curator's comments: Ptah of the Place of Beauty was venerated in the oratory before the entrance to the Valley of the Queens. Bibliography: B. Bruyère, 'Mert Seger à Deir el Médineh I (Cairo, 1930), p.52, no.10.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389927) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389927)
